messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
We had several police officers here earlier and did a report.
They told him to stay away from the house and said to call 911 if he came back.
What's his name?
He's at the front door now and he's trying to get in.
What do you mean he's trying to get in? Is he pulling on the door?
Yes, he's pulling on the door and trying the doorknob.
He just went from the back door to the front door.
Ma'am, I'll put you on hold for just a second so I can get somebody started your way, okay?
Okay.
Ma'am, are you still there?
Yes, he's trying to get in. He's threatening to break in and kill me.
Okay, we've got officers on the way. Is he still outside the residence?
Yes, he's still outside the residence. He's on the back porch now, trying to get in.
Now he's going around to the front door again.
Just stay on the phone with me, okay? Keep the doors locked and stay in a safe place.
He's banging on the windows now.
Okay, we've got officers on the way. Just stay on the line with me.
I'm trying to get his elderly mother into a safer area.
I think he's very inebriated. He's going around the front door again or one of the windows.
Oh, he's in the house!
Ma'am, can you tell me if he's inside the house?
Yes, he's in the house. Oh my God!
Ma'am, is he inside the house? Please confirm.
He's got a knife. Oh my God!
Ma'am, can you tell me if he's inside the house?
Yes, he's inside. He attacked us.
Ma'am, I need you to talk to me. What exactly happened?
She stabbed him. She stabbed him.
Where is she right now?
She's in the living room. He's on the floor.
Okay, is he breathing?
Yes, he's breathing. He's yelling.
Where is the knife now?
I put it down.
Make sure he doesn't get to that knife. Just stay on the line with me.
